channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Rising from the ashes, a symbol of hope at the Rose Parade
item.description: Survivors of the Eaton and Palisades Fires find healing and community working on a Rose Parade float to honor the lives and communities lost in last year's wildfires.
item.content:encoded:
Survivors of the Eaton and Palisades Fires find healing and community working on a Rose Parade float to honor the lives and communities lost in last year's wildfires.

(Image credit: Kirk Siegler/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Liz Baker

item.title: The history behind the NYC subway station chosen for Mamdani's swearing-in
item.description: The city shut down the station in 1945 on New Year's Eve. Eighty years later, it's a symbolic venue choice for the incoming mayor's private swearing-in ceremony.
item.content:encoded:
The city shut down the station in 1945 on New Year's Eve. Eighty years later, it's a symbolic venue choice for the incoming mayor's private swearing-in ceremony.

(Image credit: Felix Lipov)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: U.S. military strikes 5 more alleged drug boats, killing 8
item.description: The U.S. military says it struck five alleged drug-smuggling boats over two days. The attacks killed eight people, while others jumped overboard and may have survived. U.S. Southern Command did not reveal where the attacks occurred.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. military says it struck five alleged drug-smuggling boats over two days. The attacks killed eight people, while others jumped overboard and may have survived. U.S. Southern Command did not reveal where the attacks occurred.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Capitol riot 'does not happen' without Trump, Jack Smith told Congress
item.description: Former special counsel Jack Smith also described President Trump as the "most culpable and most responsible person" in the criminal conspiracy to overturn the 2020 election results, according to a transcript of Smith's closed-door interview with the House Judiciary Committee.
item.content:encoded:
Former special counsel Jack Smith also described President Trump as the "most culpable and most responsible person" in the criminal conspiracy to overturn the 2020 election results, according to a transcript of Smith's closed-door interview with the House Judiciary Committee.

(Image credit: House Judiciary Committee)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump will drop push for National Guard deployments in Chicago, LA and Portland, Ore.
item.description: Courts blocked troops from deploying in Chicago and Portland, Ore., and the Los Angeles deployment effectively ended after a judge blocked it earlier this month.
item.content:encoded:
Courts blocked troops from deploying in Chicago and Portland, Ore., and the Los Angeles deployment effectively ended after a judge blocked it earlier this month.

(Image credit: Etienne Laurent)
item.dc:creator: Alina Hartounian

item.title: What Stranger Things gets right about wormholes
item.description: The final episode of fifth season of the Netflix series Stranger Things is out this week, and the concept of a wormhole figures largely into it. While the show is a work of fiction, theoretical wormholes have making appearances for decades not only in science fiction but in actual science.
item.content:encoded:
The final episode of fifth season of the Netflix series Stranger Things is out this week, and the concept of a wormhole figures largely into it. While the show is a work of fiction, theoretical wormholes have making appearances for decades not only in science fiction but in actual science.

(Image credit: KTSDESIGN)
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Photos: The world welcomes the new year
item.description: As fireworks light the sky and crowds count down together, communities around the globe welcome 2026.
item.content:encoded:
As fireworks light the sky and crowds count down together, communities around the globe welcome 2026.

(Image credit: Izhar Khan)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Meet five new species discovered in 2025
item.description: A bumpy snailfish, Andean mouse opossum and ancient sea cow were just some of the many species described in 2025.
item.content:encoded:
A bumpy snailfish, Andean mouse opossum and ancient sea cow were just some of the many species described in 2025.

(Image credit: Alex Boersma)
item.dc:creator: Arundathi Nair

item.title: What to know about Nick Shirley, the YouTuber alleging day care fraud in Minnesota
item.description: Shirley is a 23-year-old self-described "independent YouTube journalist" who made prank videos in high school before pivoting to politics. He participated in a White House roundtable in October.
item.content:encoded:
Shirley is a 23-year-old self-described "independent YouTube journalist" who made prank videos in high school before pivoting to politics. He participated in a White House roundtable in October.

(Image credit: Adam Gray)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Greetings from Vienna, where an imperial palace hosts a holiday market for all
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.content:encoded: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.dc:creator: Nicole Werbeck
